Name: Sci-Die
Description:
Sci-Die is a nanogame consisting of one business. In addition, each player needs three dice in their personal color. 
At the beginning of the game, each player rolls their dice and places one die onto the card as their Sci-Die. The other two dice are called Dice Bots and are placed adjacent to the card. On their turn, a player can either move a Dice Bot along one of the paths on the card, or turn it over an edge to reach an adjacent position. A point is achieved when both Dice Bots show the same number as the Sci Die of that player. First player to five points is the winner. 
Two variants with more interaction are provided.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: VenomStrike Ballista XL Enemy
Description:
Deadly artillery of the Serpentmen armies, the Venomstrike Ballista fires heavy bolts of wood, feather, and bone to skewer the opponents of the tribe!

1 XL Enemy, Cards and Rules.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Shadow Lurkers Enemy Pack
Description:
Fueled by greed, these demons of the Void stalk the shadows across all worlds. Their appearance is ghastly and nightmarish with hard and wrinkled skin. They are said to absorb light and exude hate beyond time!

Includes 3 Large Enemies, Cards and Rules.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Lumia Vampires Enemy Pack
Description:
These dark broods travel by night and feed on the living! They are an ancient and nomadic band of Vampires of the old world!

Includes 6 Enemies, Cards and Rules.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Fing-o-saur
Description: Fing-o-saur is a nanogame consisting of one business card which shows a map with areas containing a letter each. The active player chooses an area and says a word and a number, with the number telling how many times the letter in that area appears in the word. The other players then hit the area with their fingers ("destroy it with their meteor") while shouting the answer. A correct answer yields a point, then it's the next player's turn. First player to reach 5 points is the winner.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Draugar Undead Vikings Enemy Pack
Description:
The Draugar are Undead creatures spoken of in Norse lore - Undead Vikings, risen back to hateful life to feed on darkness and destroy the living! We made sure that they are recognizable as Vikings based on clothing, armor, hair, and weapons. The details in the battle-damaged weapons and armor really looks like they lived and died (and lived again!) in battle!  These turned out great and we cannot wait to paint them!

Includes 6 Draugar Miniatures, Cards and Rules.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Fenris Wolves Enemy Pack
Description:
These massive beasts of Viking legend, strike fear in the hearts of the greatest of warriors. They give relentless pursuit of their prey through the dark forests of the Norse Lands. We wanted the Fenris Wolves to be really beefed up - real powerhouses.  But, the bigger, bulkier version would not easily fit on the 40mm base.  We resolved the situation by adding a base topper with chiseled rocks for him to stand upon, ready to pounce into battle! They also appear as  Fire wolves in the Caverns of Cynder and Shadow Wolves in the Forest of the Dead and Targa Plateau.

Includes 3 large Fenris Wolf miniatures, Cards, and Rules.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Hellborn Marauders Enemy Pack
Description:
The Hellborn Marauders are barbarians driven by a dark power to lay waste to the villages of the Norse Lands in their ruthless quest for domination!

The Hellborn Marauders are an awesome foil for the Viking Heroes. They are barbarians in the classic style of fantasy, but driven by a dark power. Originally, these guys were slated for just one pose, but we were very inspired when we started working on them and decided that we just had to have a second pose for variety and to add some extra detail to the enemy group.  All of the fur detail, armor, and the battered, battle-damaged shields really cement the theme of these ruthless raiders!

Includes 6 Hellborn Marauder Miniatures, Cards and Rules.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – XL Hell Bears Enemy Pack
Description:
Massive mutants beasts that bear the mark of the 'Hellborn'! These ferocious creatures have terrifying claws and a monstrous rage! They appear as Yeti on the Targa Plateau.

Includes 3 XL Enemies, Cards and Rules.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Harvester Drill Team Enemy Pack
Description:
Not much is known of the void-spanning Harvesters. Encased in massive powered suits, these drill teams wield an array of heavy machinery and weapons to mine the resources of worlds the explore.

Includes 3 Large Harvester Drill Team Enemies, Cards and Rules.

-description from publisher's website

Name: La Petite Mort: Goodie Autograph
Description:
A goodie tile for La Petite Mort, Distributed at the Cannes International Game Festival (FIJ) in 2019.

It's a place reserved for an autograph or a drawing by Davy Mourier, the illustrator of the game La Petite Mort.

This tile is like a character card played as a basic game tile, with the Darwin Arward weakness, and three soul points.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Depths of Darkness Game Supplement
Description:
Exploring new lands and voyaging across the sea into the unknown can yield treasures beyond imagination. But it can also awaken dark dreams and eldritch nightmares unfathomed by the sheltered worlds of mankind.

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Darkness cards for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around the terrors awakened by the Norse Vikings and Spanish Conquistadors setting out to explore the unknown reaches of the world…and beyond.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Spanish Fort Artifacts #2 Game Supplement
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The lush jungles and tropical islands of the New World are rich with treasures and gold. Trading with local villages and tribes, the Spanish soldiers have found many new allies and mystical relics to aid in the war with the Serpentmen.

This 15 card supplement adds a collection of all new Spanish Fort Artifacts for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around sacred relics and mystical weapons offered by the local cultures to fight back the brutal Serpentmen from Jargono.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Spanish Fort Artifacts #1 Game Supplement
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The lush jungles and tropical islands of the New World are rich with treasures and gold. Trading with local villages and tribes, the Spanish soldiers have found many new allies and mystical relics to aid in the war with the Serpentmen.

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Spanish Fort Artifacts for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around sacred relics and mystical weapons offered by the local cultures to fight back the brutal Serpentmen from Jargono.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Norse Lands Artifacts #1 Game Supplement
Description:
The icy Norse Lands are home to many savage beasts, corrupted men, and creatures of shadow, but the Norse Gods of old bless mankind with Aesir weapons forged in the furnaces of Asgard to hold the Darkness at bay.

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Norse Lands Artifacts for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around relics and weapons forged and blessed by the Norse Gods.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Norse Lands Artifacts #2 Game Supplement
Description:
The icy Norse Lands are home to many savage beasts, corrupted men, and creatures of shadow, but the Norse Gods of old bless mankind with Aesir weapons forged in the furnaces of Asgard to hold the Darkness at bay.

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Norse Lands Artifacts for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around relics and weapons forged and blessed by the Norse Gods.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Valley of the Serpent Kings – Primal Terrors Game Supplement
Description:
Slithering through the deepest jungles, the Serpentmen and their savage beasts of war have come to this 'new world' of man to conquer in the name of the Serpent Gods. The tribal drums and vicious roars send a chill of primal terror down the spine of any that would stand in their way.

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Spanish Fort Encounters for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around the Serpentmen of Jargono crossing over from their swampy realm to unleash terror on the world of Man.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Loki's Vengeance Game Supplement
Description:
A legendary trickster and mischievous manipulator, the god Loki has returned from his banishment, seeking revenge on Odin and all the realms! Pulling strings, he incites the Frost Giants of Jotunheim to attack, while the Aesir Gods are distracted battling the Thunderforged warriors of the Underworld in their bid to hold off Ragnarok.

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Norse Lands Encounters for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around the Norse God Loki with his tricks and manipulation, sewing seeds of chaos across the Nine Realms.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Frost Giant Multipack
Description:
The Frost Giants of Jotunheim have been unleashed from their icy realm! Rampaging across the land, these massive terrors wreak havok as they feed on livestock and carve a path of destruction in their wake.

This miniature set features 2 new EPIC Threat cards representing a pair of Frost Giants and a group of D3 Frost Giant Raiders for an extreme challenge, as well as 2 additional XL Frost Giant models. Can you stop the Frost Giant's rampage before they plunge the world into a frozen wasteland under the dominion of their icy king?

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Valley of the Serpent Kings – Croxin Beast Multipack
Description:
Captured by the Serpentmen of Jargono to use as living weapons of war, the mighty Croxin Beasts thrash and chomp their way through the toughest of foes, ruthlessly crushing those who find themselves in the path of their sweeping tails!

This miniature set features 2 new EPIC Threat cards representing a pair of deadly Croxin Beasts and a group of D3 Croxin Pit Thrashers for an extreme challenge, as well as 2 additional XL Croxin Beast models. The Serpentmen do not take kindly to intruders, though their terrifying Croxin Beasts are always hungry.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Jargono Artifacts #2 Game Supplement
Description:
Otherworld artifact packs add interesting new loot to the game! Includes 15 new Artifact Cards for the Jargono Otherworld.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Targa Plateau Artifacts #2 Game Supplement
Description:
Otherworld artifact packs add interesting new loot to the game! Includes 15 new Targa Artifact Cards.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Raiding Gear Game Supplement
Description:
15 new Norse Lands Gear Cards.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Valley of the Serpent Kings – Tools of Conquest Game Supplement
Description:
Includes 15 new Spanish Fort Gear Cards.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Flames of Ragnarok Game Supplement
Description:
This pack of 15 new cards expands the decks of the Norse Lands. Includes Gear, Artifacts, Encounters, and an Adventure Card to set your adventures amidst the apocalyptic times of Ragnarok!

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Valley of the Serpent Kings – Cities of Gold Game Supplement
Description:
This pack of 15 new cards expands the decks of the Spanish Fort and Swamps of Jargono. Includes Gear, Artifacts, Encounters, and an Adventure Card.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Odin's Wrath Game Supplement
Description:
This 15 card supplement adds a collection of all new Norse Lands Encounters for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around the Norse God Odin, King of the Gods.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Valley of the Serpent Kings – Dark Ambitions Game Supplement
Description:
Description from the publisher:

A Conquistador’s Ambition is beyond measure, and can be a ruthless tool when exploring the jungle or battling for survival.

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Spanish Fort Encounters for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around the Serpentmen of Jargono crossing over from their swampy realm to unleash terror on the world of Man.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Valley of the Serpent Kings – Stone Portals
Description:
These plastic doorways are a great way to trick out your Brimstone games, enhancing the theme and clearly marking available doorways.

This set includes 4 plastic Jargono Doorways, 4 Spanish Fort Doorways, and an exclusive new 15 Card Mini Expansion, plus Rules & Painting Guide.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Frozen Gates
Description:
These plastic doorways are a great way to trick out your Brimstone games, enhancing the theme and clearly marking available doorways.

This set includes 4 plastic Targa Doorways, 4 Norse Lands Doorways, and an exclusive new 15 Card Mini Expansion, plus Rules & Painting Guide.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Valley of the Serpent Kings – Map Tile Pack
Description:
Brand new set of 8 Map Tiles (including 5 Rooms and 3 Passages) themed with the Swamps of Jargono on one side and the Spanish Fort on the other. Also includes 2 exclusive new Missions, plus all of the Cards and Counters needed to add these to your games of Shadows of Brimstone!

—description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress – Rivals: Feudal Japan Heroes Card Set
Description:
Cards and record sheet for using Hero minis as rival Enemies.

Includes 19 Cards.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Rivals – Old West Heroes Card Set
Description:
Cards and record sheet for using Hero minis as rival Enemies.

Includes 29 Cards.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Rivals – Conquistador and Viking Card Set
Description:
Cards and record sheet for using Hero minis as rival Enemies.

Includes 24 Cards.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Turbo Sleuth
Description:
A murder most foul has been committed! Old Miser McGreedy’s body hasn’t even been laid to rest, and the murder suspects are already seeking to divide up his fortune. Was it his wastrel of a son? The nervous maid? The shady business partner? Or the oddly nonchalent butler? Can you nab the culprit before time runs out?

Turbo Sleuth is a puzzly speed-solving game in which players compete simultaneously to find the solution to the round's challenge. Choose one of five cases to solve, with dozens of possible solutions depending on which cards are drawn. Search quickly for the right clues, some of which might look right at first glance, but will lead you astray...

Only the first few players may attempt to solve the case, but rush to a hasty wrong judgment, and the murderer will up the ante for the next round!

—description from the publisher

Name: Zweimal Spiel und Spaß mit Goldi
Description:
Goldis buntes Würfelspiel + Goldis abebteuerliche Reise um die Welt

The players start at "Start". The first to reach "Ziel" wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

Name: Eine lehrreiche Vergnügungsfahrt mit der kleinen Eisenbahn
Description:
The players start at space 1 in Bad Ischl. 
The first to reach space 100 back in Bad Ischl wins the game. 
Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. In Salzburg the players leave the train and go on a sightseeing tour before taking the train back to Bad Ischl. That is, if they're not overrun by a motorcycle, in which case they are out of the game for good.

—user summary

Name: Swordcrafters: Expanded Expansion
Description:
The enemies are growing stronger and the King has asked you to craft an enhanced sword of protection using Sword, Relics, Sword Mastery, and Sword Tips.

This expansion contains three modules to mix and match with base Swordcrafters for amazing replay value.

Sword Mastery - Fight to claim each round and hone your blade.

Sword Tips - Player goals test how sharp you truly are.

Sword Relics - Add fragments of the past to the grid to keep your slices and selections intense.

Contents:
24 Sword Mastery Cards
12 Sword Tip Tiles
48 Sword Relic Tiles
1 Wooden First Player Token

Requires base Swordcrafters to play.

Name: Saint Seiya: Deckbuilding – Poseidon Expansion
Description:
Here is the second expansion of the Saint Seiya Deck Building Game!

What's new?
51 new cards: new characters, armors and relics.
19 new event cards adding a new game mechanism.
7 pillars cards.

A cooperative mode: using a new board and five heroes standees.
The new challenge is defeating Poseidon in his house!

Name: Gnomotecnia
Description:
A group of gnomes has gotten lost on their way home. It's getting darker, and the forest beasts are approaching. They must recall all the details of the road to guide themselves to safety before any beast surprises them...

Gnomotecnia is a twenty-card game in which each player represents one of the lost gnomes in the forest. At the start of the game, each player has in front of them four face-down pieces of a 2x2 map. To win the game, players need to correctly assemble a map using their famous good memory.

On their turn, a player can take two of these actions:


    Look at one of their cards.
    Exchange one of their cards with another player.
    Change the position of two cards of another player.
    Lock one of their cards until the end of the game, which means that no one can move it or look at it.


The game ends when a gnome announces that they have remembered a way home, meaning they have finished assembling their personal map. If they've done so, they win.

•••

Un grupo de gnomos se pierden camino a casa, está atardeciendo y las bestias comienzan a aparecer. Deben hacer memoria y recordar todos los detalles del camino para guiarse antes que alguna bestia los sorprenda desprevenidos.

Name: Blooming Industry
Description:
Running a full-fledged tulip operation isn’t easy and with such a booming tulip industry, comes fierce competition. But not everyone plays fairly…

Your goal is to reach a nice balance of plentiful farmland, a plethora of tulips, and efficient canal routes for shipping to the market! Each tulip color decreases in value with each sale, so be sure to ship & sell ‘em quick!

On your turn, perform two of the following four actions:

1. Sow: Either…
Seed - Grab a field tile from the reserve and place it in connection with another tile
OR Reseed - Grab a field tile from the reserve and place it on top of another field tile

2. Harvest: Grab your farmer from your personal supply, or another tile, and place it on a farm. You may then place a matching tulip on an available tile in this farm

3. Build: Grab a windmill from the supply and place it on a windmill tile. Boats will now automatically move one additional space when moving onto this tile

4. Transport: Move up to three boats, one tile per boat, along any of the canal paths

Your goal is to reach a nice balance of plentiful farmland, a plethora of tulips, and efficient canal routes for shipping to the market!
Each tulip color decreases in price with each sale, so be sure to ship and sell ‘em quick!

Name: Blitzkrieg: Deluxe
Description:
Blitzkrieg Deluxe is a "generic" World War 2 era wargame that pits two fictional nations against each other over a fictional land mass represented by a huge 34 by 55 inch map. The game is easy to learn with the rules clocking in at under sixeteen pages, but difficult to master as the options available to each player are numerous. Do you mass your assault at the enemy's borders, or do you employ naval forces to invade through a tenuous beachhead? How best to utilize your air forces to disrupt your enemy's economy and halt their advance into your territory?
â€‹
In addition to the huge map that is presented in easy-to-print tiles at both letter- and tabloid-sizes, the game includes over 500 markers on four sheets, four setup cards, and a double-sided player's aid card containing all of the game charts for quick reference.
â€‹
This game is a redesign of the original Blitzkrieg game published by The Avalon Hill Game Company in 1968. The project started initially as an effort to create a new, updated, and far more pleasing map on which to play the original game. This effort snowballed into creating an updated set of game pieces, including the addition of markers needed to indicate control and industrial conditions never included in the original publication. Of course, this also required the creation of new game charts to match. It wasn't too long before the rules were tackled as well.
â€‹
While working through the rules and copious errata for the original game, it seemed appropriate to rewrite the rules as well. Given enhancements in game play since 1968, these rules have been completely overhauled and enhanced with new mechanics and combat result charts to inject more excitement than the original design. The "basic game" has been stripped out and the rules reorganized to follow the sequence of play. The concepts of "initiative" (allowing for the possibility of double-turns by a player) and "straining" (allowing an attacker to push harder to gain better results, but at a risk of losses) have been introduced. The game also includes a random game-end mechanic, allowing a side more or less time to complete its conquest. Additionally, the original combat results (attrition) chart has been completely redesigned to allow for more realistic outcomes.
â€‹
In a nutshell, Blitzkrieg Deluxe is not your daddy's (or granddaddy's) Blitzkrieg! As a player you have the option to play the game with the original rules as written using the updated map and markers, or you can "upgrade" to the new rules.
â€‹
Blitz on!

Name: Pier 1
Description:
Pier 1 is a Cat Sudoku card game for one talented pier master. In the game, the player is building Pier 1 on a beautiful coast. The goal is to arrange market aisles with unique fish vendors to increase foot traffic. Yes, cats are the ecstatic fish vendors. The player will receive points during construction and more after the final inspection. Beware of cute rodents! They are negative points. When the game ends, the player will receive a star rating based on the points received. The more points you score the higher rating you will receive. Are you ready to be a 5-star Grand Pier Master?

-description from designer

Name: Hotpot Havoc
Description:
The annual Hotpot Havoc Challenge has begun! Cook, dip, and eat your way to victory against up to 4 other competitors! Fill your bowl with the best and most delicious ingredients and be the first in line to pick the perfect sauce for your ingredients, but do not overeat! Pick your bowls wisely and you might stand a chance to be the ultimate Hotpot Havoc Champion!

Hotpot Havoc is a 2-5 player game in which first pick the eating utensils of choice, which will give points based on the amount of food you put inside it. Putting too much food will result in demerit points for the round. Meanwhile, you have to quickly flip through your ingredient deck looking for the ingredients you want to keep and throwing out those you do not wish to keep in a public pot. Players can snatch up ingredients in the public pot. Once the players are happy with the ingredients they have, they can grab a turn order tag of their choice which will give them choice to select different type of sauces, which will award bonus points base on the types of ingredients they have in their containers. The player with the most points wins!

-description from designer

Name: Magna Acies! Fast "battle size" rules for 3D wargame in the Ancient age
Description:
MAGNA ACIES! is a three-dimensional wargame ruleset (i.e. played with toy soldiers and on three-dimensional terrain) that aims to reproduce, in a good balance between realism and simplicity, the great battles of the Ancient world. 
Its goal is also to bring people who have never tried this beautiful hobby closer to the three-dimensional wargame, which allows you to really "play" with the soldiers that we admire and have always loved. MAGNA ACIES! is therefore designed to remain simple and to immediately put you players in a position to really lead an army of the Antiquity, making you relive the situations that in those days could make the difference between victory and defeat.

You impersonate the commander of the army, who gives orders to the various corps from which the army is constituted: at the beginning of the battle, assign orders to your large units deployed in the field, depending on whether your plan provides that each of them must attack the enemy, or maneuver to reach a more favorable position, or even stand still waiting for the opposing charge or the development of events. Units that receive orders must act accordingly, until they clash with the enemy or until you deem it necessary to change the order for any reason.

In short, you are reproposed for the problems that the leader had to face on the ground and only those; this perspective (which can be defined as "great - tactical") involves simplifying (or automatically managing) certain aspects of detail that are not considered here as they are supposedly left to the initiative of subordinate officers, but allows you to play great battles in limited spaces and in a short time.

MAGNA ACIES! can simulate the battles of Antiquity until the advent of firearms; it was designed with classic age clashes in particular in thought, but works well as long as squares of men and horses predominantly confronted with close combat weapons.

I thought "MAGNA ACIES!" to be practical, fast and playable: in 15mm you can play even on tables less than one meter, the rules are round 25 pages including examples, illustrations and various chatter, the game tables and the "army lists" are included in a single A4 sheet, a 150 point game - army on each side can last an average of a couple of hours , once you learned the rules.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Battle Dress: Science Fiction Wargaming Rules
Description:
Battle Dress is a set of science fiction wargaming rules intended for use with 6mm (1/300) or 15mm (1/100) scale figures.

Battle Dress is:

     to fight actions of about a reinforced company on each side
     intended for multi-based figures and single vehicles/guns
     a ruleset that places stress on troop quality and uses an innovative command system to reflect better quality troops being able to do more "stuff" on average than poor quality troops
     a ruleset that includes all the weapon and vehicle stats you need to play right away, drawn from the Traveller science fiction universe
     blessed by Traveller designer Marc W Miller
     full of science fiction elements like grav vehicles, warbots and fusion guns
     fully capable of handling actions between forces of very different technology levels
     intended to fill the gap in between RPG/single-figure skirmish combat systems and large-scale abstract mass battle systems.


—description from the publisher

Name: ASL Comp: GWASL XV – Vimy Ridge and Beyond: Canadian WW1
Description:
Some 619,636 Canadians enlisted with the Canadian Expeditionary Force during the war, and approximately 424,000 served overseas. Of these men and women, 59,544 members of the CEF died during the war, 51,748 of them as a result of enemy action. The CEF served with distinction at Neuve-Chappelle, and at 2nd Ypres in 1915 they made a legendary stand to hold the line during the first gas attack on the Western Front. Posted to the Somme in September 1916, the CEF fought the sanguinary battles for Mouquet Farm and Courcelette, taking the 2nd German line that was an objective of the failed 1 July attack. Posted back to Arras in 1917 the CEF finally cracked the defenses of Vimy Ridge in a brilliant attack, which had defied both the French and British for the past 2 years. Posted back to the Ypres area in the fall of 1917, the CEF was tasked with taking Passchendaele in October and November, in appalling weather.   This was the final push to that town that had been an objective since August. In abysmal weather the CEF finally captured it in November 1917.  In 1918 the CEF was in the forefront of the great offensive that ground down the German army in the west, in fact, the 2nd Canadian division advanced past Mons on 11 November 1918 to finish the war where it had begun for the BEF 4 long years ago.

All of these battles were hard fought affairs, where no quarter was asked or given. Now, with this latest GWASL module you get to see if you can match the exploits of this fearsome fighting force on some of the most pitiless battlefields of World War I.

Ownership of ASL-RB, GWASL 1 and all preceding GWASL modules required to play.

Scenarios:

     Cheers For The Living - Bellewaerde Ridge, Belgium, May 8th 1915
     High And Dry - Ypres, Belgium    WW1, June 2nd 1916
     Kitchener's Wood - Langemark, Belgium    WW1, April 22nd 1915
     A Cane And A Lionheart - St. Julien, Belgium, April 23rd 1915
     Gravenstafel - Gravenstafel, Belgium    WW1, April 25th 1915
     Courcelette - Courcelette, France, September 15th 1916
     Sanctuary Wood - Hooge, Belgium, June 2nd 1916
     The Pimple - Vimy Ridge, France, April 10th 1917


Contents:

     4 Geo Boards
     8 scenarios in color format
     368 die-cut counters - The Canadians
     Color 3-hole rules sheet
     Color cardstock folder style wrap.

Name: Sternenschweif: Der silberne Stern
Description:
The Silver Star is the brightest star in the twinkling night sky. Its power allows unicorns to live on earth. But suddenly Laura and her unicorn Star Tail discover that the light of the star is getting weaker and weaker. Help Laura and Starletail find all of the Silver Star's starspikes before its light goes out! Only together can the players make the magical star sparkle again and save all the unicorns.

In this game all children play together and try to beat the game by finding the prongs of the silver star before it reaches the end of the timeline and its light goes out forever. The game lasts about 20 minutes and is suitable for players aged 6 and up.

-translation of publisher's website

Name: Masters of Math: Minus Edition
Description:
Masters of Math – Minus Edition is a card educational game played by two to four players. This game helps children to learn subtraction basics up to 10 and quickly calculate tasks in their head. It also practices the comparison of numbers: bigger, smaller, equal.

The object of the game is to be the fastest to solve math equations in your head correctly and to get rid of all your cards. The person who calculates the quickest and has the card with the correct solution puts the corresponding solution card on top of the equation card. The player obtains this pair of cards and places it in front of themselves. The player who collected the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

—description from publisher

Name: Heads Will Roll
Description:
Everyone knows dragons love hoarding gold in their caves and laying waste to any would-be intruders. It turns out dragons also have designed their own game using the leftovers...

To play, take turns rolling a fistful of pieces out across the table and flicking your Shield through the scattered Skulls to earn (or lose) points. Hit the treasure chest to bank those points and add them to your total. First player to reach 21 points wins.

The game uses most of the same basic rules as Dragoon: Heads Will Roll but has some additions, changes, different physical components, and new art. If you dig D:HWR you'll be way into this.

-description from designer

Name: Die Schule der magischen Tiere: ermittelt – Klarer Fall, Murphy!
Description:
There is a lot of excitement in the magical pet shop! Several animals have disappeared without a trace overnight. No question that polar bear Murphy immediately starts investigating. But the master detective needs the help of the players.

In this cooperative game, players work closely together to track down the culprits. Only if the detectives cleverly combine Murphy's clues will they save the magical animals. Thus begins an exciting adventure in which each player plays his part in solving the case.

Name: Feuerwehrmann Sam: Allzeit bereit!
Description:
Fireman Sam and his friends are always ready to help the residents of Pontypandy.

On your turn, you roll the color die. Then you may take a puzzle tile from the center of the table that has the same colored dot as the rolled color. Each player may only take one puzzle tile per round. If you roll the color of which you already have the puzzle tile in front of you, you will not be able to take a tile in this round. Then it's the next player's turn. The first player to complete a puzzle wins the game.

Name: Die Geschichte vom kleinen Siebenschläfer, der nicht einschlafen konnte
Description:
Sleep, little dormouse, sleep! Everyone is getting ready for hibernation, only the little dormouse isn't tired at all yet. Who can help the little one? It's up to the players! They join in the search for valuable tips on how to fall asleep. In this board game, they move their game piece along the path and uncover memo cards that can help them. The matching motif was not found? Then the next player tries his luck.

On their way, the toddlers meet fox, nightingale, snail and co. who give everything to bring the dormouse to dreamland. Whoever reaches the last path map and discovers the card with the yawning dormouse is the winner! A wonderful party game with a story about sleeping and cuddling for toddlers, parents and grandparents.

Name: Stadt Land Würfelspaß
Description:
In this creative word and dice game, players try to find terms with the same initial letters as quickly as possible.

Everyone plays at the same time. Like in the well-known word game Scategories, the goal is to fill in all the squares and thus collect the most points at the end of the round. In Stadt Land Würfelspaß, however, new themes are rolled before the game, making the game varied and exciting!

Name: BLASTER: Games Anthology 02
Description:
BLASTER – the independent wargaming anthology – returns! Five of wargaming’s most prolific indie designers bring you exclusive expansions for their awesome games as well as entirely new tabletop gaming experiences.

BLASTER: Volume 2 contains:

Mystic Skies - Mike Hutchinson and Sean Sutter - Imagine yourself as a powerful sorcerer, soaring above the desert on a magic carpet. Combining the nail-biting movement of Gaslands with brutal magic and combat systems, Mystic Skies is a complete and standalone wargame of high-speed magical duels, tower defence and monster hunting.

This Is Not A Test: Masters of the Wild (Part 2) - Joey McGuire - Following from our first installment of this expansion for This Is Not A Test, we now examine the lesser powers of the wild who can join your warband.  From the the nefarious beast controller who psychically dominates creatures into subservience to the beast friend, a natural animal empath.  We also include lesser versions of the tribal wildcaller of chimeric wildshaper.  Finally, animal skills are introduced, which are really fun and thematic and give your warbands an animal appeal.

Shadowgrave, Part I – Joseph A. McCullough - What happens when the creatures of the Mythos invade Frostgrave, Ghost Archipelago, and Rangers of Shadow Deep? Rules for sanity, madness, and permanent mental damage! Includes a new scenario for each of the three games, plus a host of nefandous creatures!

Last Days: Evolutions – Ash Barker - Last Days: Evolutions brings new threats to your Post Apocalypse. You can totally re-theme your games of Last Days to include new types of the Undead or shift gears entirely to try to survive an unshackled AI collapsing civilization!

—description from the publisher

This PDF document presents print-and-play expansion modules for several miniatures games, noted above.
—user summary

Name: Histórias de Pescador (Edição Mini)
Description:
Histórias de Pescador (Edição Mini) reimplements Histórias de Pescador, but in a small and portable format. The gameplay remains the same as the original.

It is the last fishing season of the year and everyone got together to tell stories of their biggest catch. Anything goes to get the group's admiration and the title of best fisherman.

During his turn, a player must lower at least one card from his hand, face down, and declare a type of fish. The other players can choose to believe or ask for proof. If the other players don't believe him, the player must reveal his card(s) and, depending on whether he is being honest or not, win or lose points.

The game continues with the players until someone successfully discards the last card in their hand, telling their last story and becoming the best fisherman in the group.

--description from publisher

Name: Pájaros en el Alambre
Description:
The title Pájaros en el Alambre means Birds on the Wire. The game consists of cards with ten different birds, all armed with guns. 
At the beginning of the game, a wire with 10 different birds is laid out on the table. During their turn, a player may choose to either exchange a card from their hand with a card on the wire; or move a card on the wire to the left or right (as stated on the card). Each kind of bird has a requirement as to how many of them must be adjacent to another to form a set. When a player creates a set, they take out those birds as score cards and replace them with cards from the pile. When the wire cannot be refilled, the player with most points is the winner.

Name: Antes del Diluvio
Description:
Antes del Diluvio (a.k.a. "Before the Flood") takes place in the year 2070, just twelve hours before the extinction of the last living creatures on Earth. Robots that now rule the Earth are determined to gather different kinds of DNA as long as it is still available so that they can eventually recreate life on other planets.

Each hour is played as one round. On your turn, you have four action points to draw DNA tiles from different bags, put them into their incubator, or move them from the incubator to your habitat. The tiles have different shapes and sizes and must be placed to fit the habitat or the incubator. Each round has a different objective which, if fulfilled, gets you victory points. After twelve rounds, the player with most victory points wins.

Name: Brujas del Sabado
Description:
BRUJAS DEL SABADO is a trick-taking game about feasting with four Spanish witches.  The player with the most points wins.

The game is a "must follow" experience, but rather than following the suit of the first player, the card played by the second player, and that card's relation to the first card played, will determine the follow type for the round.

The suits are strictly ranked, both in strength and in point value.  The winner of a trick must make an adjustment to the strength of the winning suit, and the players will each draft a card played to the trick to their score pile.

At the end of the game, players will earn points based upon both the suits collected and the ranks collected.

Name: Coup: Promo Bufão & Burocrata
Description:
The buffoon or "Bobo da Corte" is a promo card used to replace the Ambassador card.

A player who claims the role of the Jester can cause Disorder by taking a card from the Court deck and a target card (another player of his choice).  The player can secretly change one of his cards between one of the two cards received.  The player returns a card to the Court deck and a card to his target (the player he had chosen).

The target may also claim that the player does not have the role of the Jester and thus prevent him from having a stolen card and that the Jester himself collects a card from the Court deck.

If the target has a Captain's card, the Captain can claim the Jester in order to block the card's theft.

"The Bureaucrat" is a promo card used to replace the Duke (Duke) card.

Name: Rack-Stack
Description:
Rack-Stack is played on a diamond-shaped grid of 16 spaces. Each player has eight pieces in their color.

One unusual feature of the game is that the players must pretend that the board is vertical; a piece can only be placed if it is supported on both "lower" sides by other pieces or the board edges.

The other unusual feature is that players may play pieces of either color. However, at the end of the game players only score for their own pieces.

Scoring is for sets of three pieces at the points of an equilateral triangle. These can be made in three sizes which are worth from one to three points.

Name: ASL Comp: Hindenburg Line – Battle of Vierstraat Ridge 1918
Description:
VIERSTRAAT RIDGE, BELGIUM, 2 SEPTEMBER 1918: The Hindenburg Line was originally organized for defense toward the end of the year 1916, and work was continuous in its preparation for a long time thereafter. 
The Siegfried Line makes full use, along extended stretches, of the front line of defense accorded by the Bellicourt-St. Quentin Canal. 
The strength of these defenses, increased as it is by inundated areas, provided extensive mutual flanking fire support. Good artillery observation rendered the line very strong. The Siegfried Line is considered to create the most favorable conditions for a stubborn defense by a minimum garrison. It is therefore adapated to the requirements of obstinate close combat.

Ownership of GWASL 1 and GWASL 3 are required, as is your ASL-RB. 
All the other combat counters needed to play are provided in the form of 648 color die-cut counters.

Scenarios:
Vierstraat, Belgium

     Captains and Majors, August 31st 1918
     The Vierstraat Switch, August 31st 1918
     Blind Courage, August 31st 1918
     Redoubt Farm, September 1st 1918
     Riposte In Lead, September 1st 1918
     Back To Chinese Trench, September 1st 1918
     Handiwork Of The Devil, September 1st 1918
     Vierstraat Ridge, September 1st 1918

Name: Hawker Life
Description:
Hawker Life is a game for everyone who enjoys the hawker experience, just as we do. From the variety of food to the hustle and bustle, we aim to keep this unique culture alive in all our hearts!

From collaboration to competition, fresh-faced newbies to roughed-up veterans, our game mirrors what hawkers face as they go about their business. In this game, it’ll be a battle of wits to see who comes out as the Head Hawker by opening all the stalls in front of you!

The objective of the game is to be the first to complete all the stalls in front of you.

Collect ingredients to open up the stalls, collaborate with your neighbours to open the food stalls together, and use a variety of action cards to take advantage of your competitors' weaknesses.

—description from the publisher

Name: Simon's Cat: Total Mess
Description:
In Simon's Cat: Total Mess, the deck is composed of pictures with connected drawings and special "Simon's Cat" cards. Players draw cards and lay them in a row until a card with no number in the corner is drawn. The first player to connect objects from the first to the last card and correctly name the last objects gathers all the challenge cards and keeps them. Players guessing incorrectly return a card to the deck. When a special Simon's Cat card comes up, the first player to shout "Simon's Cat!" wins the card for extra points at the end of the game.

The game stops when all the cards in the deck have been used. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Justice League
Description:
Unite to fight evil! Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman, Aquaman, Cyborg and Flash join forces to create the Justice League. Together they will fight evil with their super powers and free the world from the attacks of super villains. Advance from city to city eliminating the "Parademons" to reach the final square where only the survivors can face Steppenwolf and try to defeat him. The cooperative Superhero game where strategy makes the difference.
Can be played as a team or solo. A collaborative game against the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Hellboy: The Board Game – Deluxe Edition
Description:
Hellboy: The Board Game is a co-operative experience in which players face off against some of the comic's most famous foes. Up to four people take control of iconic BPRD members, such as Hellboy, Abe Sapien, and Roger the Homunculus, then explore gothic locations and uncover ancient artifacts.

The game features pre-assembled plastic miniatures that accurately capture the look and feel of Mike Mignola's world famous comic series.


Deluxe Edition includes:

     Hellboy: The Board Game
     Conqueror Worm Expansion
     BPRD Archives Expansion
     Bonus Minions
     Kickstarter Exclusive Alternate Hellboy
     digital edition of Seed of Destruction graphic novel
     all applicable stretch goals

Name: Blitz-Spiel
Description:
The players start with one pawn at space 1 and go to space 50 and change to the round course from space I to XII. Movement is determined by one or two dice. One or more pawns may occupy each space with the exception of spaces II, V, VIII and XI.

If a pawn stands on one of these 4 spaces, lightning stikes all other pawns standing on the same lightning bolt, eliminating them from the game. Then the pawn, that initiated the lightning strike starts anew from space 1.

If a meeple reaches space 50 exactly, it starts anew at space 1.

The player with the last pawn in play wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Myraclia: Eternity
Description:
Eternal powers...waiting on Myraclia...hidden from the eyes of the mighty...but generously revealed to those who appear feeble

- - - RULES - - -

CONTENT: 16 double-sided Eternity Tokens

SETUP: Just place all Eternity tokens back-side up next to the scoring board.

RULES: At the end of each round (except the last round), the last player on the scoreboard (in case of a tie, tied player who terraformed later in this round) randomly selects one token and places the token on any free Myraclia tile (i.e. not terraformed, not reserved), face-up.

Remember: Myraclia with Eternity token placed on it is available to all players in the subsequent rounds.

Depending on the type of Eternity token, the player who terraforms Myraclia hex with Eternity token (or more tokens) placed on it gains a certain advantage/bonus.

—description from the publisher

Name: Myraclia: Darkness
Description:
Not all parts of Myraclia are life welcoming... there are some deep dark voids you rather don't want to be close to... they do not allow you to shape Myraclia according to your visions ...so it is much better if they stand in the path of your opponents.

- - - RULES - - -

CONTENT: 3 Darkness Tiles

SETUP: After the setup (pages 6-8), mix Darkness Tiles with other Myraclia Tiles in the Tiles Supply.

RULES: If the Darkness Tile is drawn from the Tiles Supply, it is placed on Tiles Display like any other Tile. The Player expanding Myraclia surface at the end of their turn must choose Darkness Tile first if there is one available on Tiles Display. Darkness Tiles cannot be terraformed.

Remember: There may not be more than 1 Darkness tile on Tiles Display. If another Darkness Tile is drawn while there is Darkness Tile on Display already, put it back in the bag and draw a replacement.

Important: We recommend using this expansion only for experienced players

—description from the publisher

Name: Fußball-Wettspiel
Description:
Each player has 11 tokens which are placed on the black spots on the game board. Movement is determined by a die according to following special rules:

1 - The goal keeper (T) moves forward one space diagonaly. If the keeper leaves the penalyty box, the opponent rolls two times, on a result of 8 or more, he sets the nearest forward- or midfield player on a red spot and scores a goal and the keeper is reset to his starting point.

3 - One of the three midfield players (L) moves 3 spaces in a straight line from his starting point.

4 - One of the five forward players (S) moves 4 spaces in a straight line from his starting point.

2 and 5 - A forward or midfield player not standing on his starting point moves 2 or 5 spaces.

6 - A defense player (V) moves 2 spaces diagonaly forward. If a defense player passes line A, the opponent gets a free turn.

Every time a forward- or midfield player reaches a red spot near the goal of the opponent, a goal is scored and the token remains there for the rest of the game. The first player to score all 8 goals wins the game.

—user summary

Name: One Piece: Pour une poignée de berrys
Description:
The most famous characters of the manga clash in this One Piece game!

Luffy and his friends have set themselves a challenge: collect as many Berrys as possible. For this they are ready to do anything in this beautiful board game One Piece!

The goal of the game? To collect as many Berrys as possible in order to reach first the objective received at the beginning of the game. To do this, each player will have to use their ACTION cards and foil their opponents' attacks. He will also be able to recover the treasures collected by his opponents. Beware, the powers of the characters will make the game full of twists and turns!

And to prolong the adventure, Obyz has created the One Piece For a Fistful of Berrys expansion!

Name: Langskip
Description:
Langskip is a 2-4 player bluffing game. You are a Viking who has been mistakenly sent to the realm of Helheim, usually reserved for those who died dishonourably. It becomes a race to Asgard before your fellow Vikings to convince Odin that you should be allowed entry into the glorious golden hall of Valhalla!

On your turn, you can use the power of the gods to guide you through the four realms quicker than your opponents by playing one of the two cards in your hand face down. Still, the other players must choose whether to believe that you played the card you said or accuse you of mischief and reveal the card for everyone to see. If your accusation is successful, you gain a mischief token; if you lie successfully without being accused, you gain a mischief token. Mischief tokens are used to make Loki and his children stronger, giving you an even better chance of arriving at Asgard first.

Will you be mischievous, or will you keep everyone on the worthy path and reap the benefits of their ill-deeds?

—description from the designer

Name: One Piece: Extension – Pour une poignée de berrys: Les 7 Grands Corsaires
Description:
A One Piece expansion that comes with new cards to renew your One Piece board game For a Fistful of Berrys.

The rules remain the same as for the base game (except that you can only play event cards of the same type once per turn). The 7 CHARACTER cards will allow you to play with new powers. The characters remain iconic like Doflamingo.

The new ACTION cards will diversify the game to make it even more explosive! Play for example the "Longue-Vue" card which will allow you to steal the card of your choice from one of your opponents.

Included! A cloth bag with One Piece colors to store your One Piece board game.

Attention! Requires the One Piece game For a handful of Berrys.

Name: Gray Eminence: Year of Chaos
Description:
The good, the bad, and the ugly of 2020 – the year the hits just kept on coming.

Not since the war years has the world had to work so hard to find succor. As science worked to save us, creativity and ingenuity became our tools of survival during the stresses of lockdown. But for some dark masters, our Annus Horribilis brought new opportunities…

Revisit the secret world of the Gray Eminences, in this expansion to the innovative base game of manipulations and administrations. Become the power behind the thrones that suddenly no-one wished to sit on.

Annus Horribilities turned in to an expansion. No rule changes, but just more of the high-quality content!

—description from the publisher

Name: Outer Planet Panic
Description:
Welcome to Outer Planet Panic, the game of archeology in space, where you play an institution that is racing with your opponents to become the first to reverse engineer and activate alien technology. In the distant future man has expanded beyond the stars and has found a galaxy where several advanced civilizations lived. Through initial research, it has been discovered that they created several great advancements, some of which you have found.

You think you know what you need to create the device but now you must search through planets, debris fields, and radioactive areas of space in order to find the components needed to put the devices together. The galactic museum is willing to help, for a price. You can also hire workers to help you or hinder your opponents, buy equipment to make digging and research easier, and be careful because bad luck or good luck can strike at any time in the vast emptiness of space.

You start out by given fund from your sponsors to explore and dig up ancient alien artifacts Depending on your D-12 Dice role. The goal is to collect seven specific items, Research them, activate them and once you have collected 7 of said items you can try to activate the ultimate Device using the cards and take over the galaxy.

Beware, the other players may use spies to Saratoga your items, They or you can dig up gadgets from the space ship salvage yard. Sell items to do more deal making and  there are events that can inhibit or help you each cycle. To help you with your mission you can hire freelancers sell items to the research academy. But be careful you might be selling somethings the other players needs.

Work together to stab each other in the back. Make deals, Saratoga your friends. Be the first to develop the ultimate device to win the game!  Included are 6 planets, a space port, black hole, item cards, Event cards, personal cards, equipment cards, the ultimate device cards, player pieces and sponsors cards. The game also included 6 D-12. Starsmanught base worlds and more!

—description from the designer

Name: Vindication: Community Promo Pack 2
Description:
15 promotional cards inspired by backer's concepts during the Vindication: Chronicles Kickstarter campaign.

2021 printed on pack cover.

This pack includes:
Companion - Xina, Pithy Mage
Companion - Kyrin, the Runegazer
Companion - One-Shot Dara
Companion - Anabet, Protector of the Wilds
Loot - The Celestisphere
Loot - Pickled Strootling
Monster - Maku, Rain of Pain
Monster - Shrieking Beak Hound
Monster - The Skittering Maw
Pet - Aria, the Winged Chime
Pet - Bokopo, Crystalhoof
Pet - Furlan, Plains Stalker
Relic - Kaku, Avian Cloak
Trait - Inner Peace
Visionary - Moh't, Dremacatcher

Name: Forgotten Waters: DLC Pack 1 – Kraken's Eye
Description:
Cap'n Lory ain't got experience or smarts, but that ain't gonna stop him from bein' the greatest, most legendary pirate who ever sailed the seas — and he's got the perfect plan to do it, too: Sail through a never-endin' storm and rip a magical eye out o' Hellmaw, the legendary kraken who lives there.

As a member o' the senior crew in Forgotten Waters: DLC Pack 1 – Kraken's Eye, you get to help the captain on this treacherous mission. Lucky you! Sure, some folk would shy away from such a task, but with Lory's leadership, nothin' could go wrong! If only Spooky Jed would stop goin' on about the end o' the world. Oh, no matter! It's probably nothin'!

—description from the publisher

Name: Script Terror
Description:
You are the director of a B terror movie, but you have concurrence. You must run to to show your movie in to the audience before your opponents. Gather the perfect crew, find a suitable location and delay your opponents efforts on these funny card game.

Each turn the player buys a card from a shared deck of cards containing all types of cards (from actors to locations) or the top card from the discard pile, and see if the card fits in his goals (according to his script card, some sort of objective card).

After that, the active player must use one action card or discard a card.

The first player to fulfill his script cart is the winner.

The game was self published by the author after a successful Catarse (the equivalent of KS in Brazil) campaign.

Name: DiceDek
Description: The objective of the game is to be the first player to play off all of his/her cards and go out. The game makes use of a custom set of 36 numbered cards, six jokers, and two dice. The cards are first dealt evenly to all of the players. On their turn, a player rolls a dice and tries to match the dice with the cards he/she has that are of the same denomination, which is then placed in the discard pile. If he is able to discard, he throws again until he can no longer discard any cards, at which point the dice (and play) passes to the next player. Numbers are divided into blocked and free numbers. Free numbers can be used by other players to discard their cards if the player whose turn it was could not discard his/her cards. Blocked numbers can only be used by the player throwing the dice. Jokers serve as wild cards.

Name: iKnow Edycja Rodzinna
Description:
A family version of a popular quiz game iKnow. ("Edycja Rodzinna" is Polish for "Family Edition".)

Like in other games from this series, to win you need more than knowledge. You have to know your opponents well in order to predict how they will answer their questions. In the family edition of iKnow, this factor is more important than it was before, because you will not only bet if your opponent answers correctly or not, but also you will have a chance to outsmart your rivals. In this edition, you choose one out of four answers.

Name: Birdie
Description:
In Birdie, play as a silly bird-golfer with a unique ability and jump on to the golf course!

Create your own terrains using brilliant modular tiles or play on over 18 different premade terrains. Select your clubs wisely or push your luck to complete the courses in the fewest strokes possible! Beware of sand pits, water ponds, and many other natural obstacles if you want to avoid any penalties!

On your turn, play a card from your hand or push your luck with the first card of the deck. Then, add any card with the same value to boost your stroke even further. Caddies will let you add another card to the mix, and wedges will help you get out of the sand. The higher the value of your stroke, the further your ball will go! With trees to bounce off your ball, hills to change where it lands, and other golfers messing around the course, each game creates its own story.

Choose the game length by playing 6, 9 or 18 holes and test your skills to elect the new champion!

Play with 4 others concurrents, in teams, or simply try to beat your own score in solitaire. Birdie offers a simple and quick gameplay that truly lives up to the experience of Golf.

-description from designer

Name: Paleo: The Initiation Rite
Description:
A new generation has grown up. Today is their big day: the four aspirants must each pass a test to become a full member of the tribe.

Module L is about the trial that the 4 young tribe members have to take. The 4 character cards are distributed among the players and they try to pass the exams together.

This module can only be played together with Paleo. It is particularly suitable for getting to know the game. Together with module A or B, it is an alternative to level I. The Initiation Rite offers enough challenges for advanced players as well.

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot LITE
Description:
AN INTRODUCTION TO THE QUEST!

Killer Bunnies Lite is a simplified version of the full Quest for the Magic Carrot game (start with the QUEST section if you want to explore more). Lite is a stand-alone game is not compatible with any other Killer Bunnies game; however, you can incorporate the 10 Carrots into your full Quest game!

Name: ASL Comp: Major Upham – Battle Pack
Description:
A collection of scenarios from various fronts and time.
It requires ownership of the ASL-RB and many other supplements from MMP as well as CH (for more details consult Desperation Morale site).

Scenarios:

     The Blowtorch Battalion - Near the River Udy, Ukraine, February 12th 1943
     Battle's Red Glare - Montreval, France, September 2nd 1944
     A Grim Brick Sentinal - Stalingrad, Russia, November 13th 1942
     Of Volunteers, Boy Scouts and Police - Grodno, Poland, September 21st 1939
     Heaven Sent - Chaumont, Belgium, December 23rd 1944
     Hitler's Right Hand Man - Malmedy, Belgium, December 21st 1944
     The Liberation March - Szack, Poland, September 28th 1939
     The Blowtorch Battalion II - Near the River Udy, Ukraine, February 12th 1943
     Elan of the 11th Dragoons - Marilles, Belgium, May 13th 1940
     Big Trouble in Little Stalingrad - Ponyri Station, Russia, July 10th 1943

Name: Jellybeans
Description:
Jellybeans is played with a standard deck of cards, minus the court cards. Each player is assigned a color (with two players) or a suit (with more; with three one suit is removed).

Players receive hands of five cards and take turns drawing and then playing one card (or discarding and drawing three cards). Cards are placed in five "baskets" (rows of cards) - the cards represent packages of jellybeans.

When each basket has four cards the game is over. Each basket scores for the owner of the suit with the most jellybeans (pips); the score is the total number of jellybeans plus the number of different flavors (suits).

Name: ASL Comp: Cambrai 1 – Armoured Fist 1917
Description:
ASL Comp: Cambrai 1 – Armoured Fist 1917
This is Part 1 of the largest Great War historical module produced.
Maps for Cambrai parts 2 and 3, Fontaine and Bourlon, join together, the top right of the Fontaine map overlaps with the bottom left of the Bourlon map.

Printed trench networks, rattling tanks of the earliest vintage ... Highlanders ... Stosstruppen ... this is a limited collection and print run.

This is a monster game and includes 4 sheets of color die-cut counters, special rules and 90+ hours of scenarios set on the historical map provided. Large historical map.

Ownership of the ASLRB, plus GWASL 1 required.

Scenarios:
Flesquieres (south-west of Cambrai), Nord, France
November 20th 1917, British vs German

     Armored Fist, 
     Sledgehammer, 
     Kamerad!
     Corporal McBeath,
     Deborah,
     Crack A Nut,
     Day's End,
     Tankschlacht

Name: Dungeon Fighter: Collector's Edition
Description:
A "big box" deluxe edition of Dungeon Fighter offered during the Dungeon Fighter Kickstarter, for a complete Dungeon Fighter experience. The box contained:

- The components of Dungeon Fighter (Second Edition).
- The components of Dungeon Fighter in the Labyrinth of Sinister Storms.
- The components of Dungeon Fighter in the Castle of Frightening Frosts.
- The components of Dungeon Fighter in the Catacombs of Gloomy Ghosts.
- The components of Dungeon Fighter in the Chambers of Malevolent Magma.
- The Kickstarter-exclusive metal Party Leader token.
- The Metal Upgrade Pack of 30 metal Gold Coins coins and 18 metal Scars.
- The Silicone Trays Pack of two foldable silicone trays.
- The Embroidered Cloth Bags Pack.
- All the stretch goals unlocked in the campaign.
- The Hero Betty Loudscream offered during the campaign.

Name: Choosy
Description:
Choosy is played on a small (16-space) board using six pieces each of three different types (e.g. three denominations of coins).

On a turn a player either places any piece in an empty space or takes a piece to indicate they will score that type at the end of the game; the latter move can only be made once and can't be the last move.

At the end of the game players score for opposing and neutral pieces that are between two of "their" pieces.

Name: Mutant Mudds Deluxe
Description:
Defeat the Mutant Mudds and collect the Water Sprites... WITH YOUR FRIENDS! The official Mutant Mudds Deluxe tabletop game uses a dynamic modular board game system and contains 2 bonus Mutant Mudds mini games.

Features:

     Gorgeous hand-painted artwork
     An adaptable Dynamic Board Game System
     2-4 player gameplay
     Combine with other Game Decks (like Mutant Mudds Super Challenge) for fun expansions
     2 Bonus Unique Mutant Mudds Deluxe Mini-Games
     Extra cards to create your own Board Designs


Players must collect Water Sprites by purchasing them with points they earn during gameplay. The player with the most Water Sprites at the end wins!

It's time to get Muddy!

Name: Mutant Mudds Super Challenge
Description:
Defeat the Mudd Bosses and collect the Water Sprites... with your friends!

Players can have a blast playing this brand-new official Mutant Mudds table-top game, with 5 super challenging Mudd Bosses and 3 unique maps exclusively featured in Mutant Mudds Super Challenge Game Decks!

Combine Mutant Mudds Super Challenge Game Decks with Mutant Mudds Deluxe Game Decks for an official crossover board. Players can also create their own Board Design to play with your friends! Boost your Board Card options with both Mutant Mudds Deluxe and Super Challenge Game Decks!

Features:

     Gorgeous hand-painted artwork
     An adaptable Dynamic Board Game System
     2-4 player gameplay
     Combine with every other Game Decks Party Styled game (like Mutant Mudds Deluxe) for fun expandable gameplay
     2 exclusive Mutant Mudds Super Challenge Mini-Games
     5 unique Mudd Bosses to conquer
     3 official Board Designs (including one from the creator of Mutant Mudds)


Players must collect Water Sprite Token Cards by purchasing them with points they've earned during gameplay. The player with the most Water Sprites at the end wins!

Name: Pea Ridge/Elkhorn Tavern Campaign: Umpire's Guide
Description:
This booklet is designed to help an umpire put together a historical and realistic campaign for any number of players for the Pea Ridge/Elkhorn Tavern Campaign.

Adaptable to multiple rule systems.

Name: Battles For the Shenandoah: A Death Valley Expansion
Description:
The Game: Battles for the Shenandoah: A Death Valley Expansion contains four battle games with multiple scenarios. 

     McDowell, May 8, 1862
     2nd Winchester, June 13, 14, and 15, 1863
     Piedmont, June 5, 1864
     Cool Spring, July 18, 1864


Experienced players will be able to play many of the scenarios in one sitting. The game reflects the development of the cavalry and the changes in infantry and artillery organization and tactics from 1862 through 1864.

TIME SCALE: Each Turn = 1 Hour
MAP SCALE: 145 Yards Per Hex with 25-Foot or 50-Foot Elevations
UNIT SCALE: 50 Men or 1 Cannon per Strength Point

COMPONENTS
560 counters
Two 17” x 22” double-sided maps
Two 11” x 17” double-sided maps
One 8 1/2” x 11” map
One Battle booklet
Eight Activation and Turn Record charts
One Terrain Effects Chart
One Range Effects Chart

The remaining components necessary for play can be found in GMT’s Death Valley: Battles for the Shenandoah. These include the Player Aid Cards, the 2nd Disorder Chart, the game markers, four maps, and a ten-sided die. The GBACW Series Rules can be found on the GMT website.
Families: Series: Great Battles of the American Civil War (Richard H. Berg)

Name: Mountain
Description:
Mountain is played with two decks of standard playing cards plus optional jokers.

In the solitaire game the decks are shuffled together and 12 cards are dealt in a row to form the base of the mountain. The player takes one card from the deck at a time and places it in the discard pile; the top card of the discard stack is available to play on the mountain.

A card on one level is placed above two cards on the next lower level. If the cards are different ranks and suits the new card must match the rank of one and the suit of the other; otherwise it must match what they have in common. (If the cards are identical any card can be played on them.)

When the deck runs out and all plays have been made, cards score based on what level they are on.

In the two-player game one player has a deck of red cards and the other black. The base is made up of alternating red and black cards and players draw cards into their hands, from which they may play any number of cards. The winner is the player with the most cards on the top level, but if a player can complete an entire level by themselves they win immediately.

Name: 15 Days: Feathers & Lag Season
Description: Mini expansion, introduces 5 new feather tokens that can be used to get one of the animal abilities during that action and 6 Lag cards that will add choices to boost your score during each season.

Name: Space Lunch: The Spices
Description: Introduces three thirst cards and six spice tokens that will bring interesting choices to your strategy.

Name: Potlatch Klone
Description:
[Overview]
Pile up chips on your pawns route.
You win if you have 3 your stacks when your turn begins.
Which is the best? Increase your stacks?
Break opponent stacks? Or create new area?
This is the abstract strategy game what torment your brain.

[Rule Overview]
You win when there are 3 your stacks at your turn begins.
Play "Move Pawn" or "Move Chip" twice in your turn.
Increase chips when you play "Move Pawn".
You can put your color chip when stack height become 3. (This stack become your stack.)
You can destroy opponent stack by "Move Chip".

Name: Golems: Sound and Time
Description: Mini expansion that introduces two new Sound Golems that act as wilds for both resources and summoned golems and four new Time Golems that have wilds as resources.

Name: Maze Match
Description:
Players competitively race to the centre of a maze, in order to instantly win the game.

Maze Match is player in rounds, in which players first indicate how many spaces they wish to move, then a card is revealed that shows possible movement restrictions, and then in turn each player token is moved on the board. If a player moved as many spaces as indicated at the start of the round, that player receives points. A player must be in possession of 10 points to be allowed entry to the centre of the maze.

Maze Match offers additional rules for experienced players in the form of blocking/unblocking restriction cards by spending points, and in adding guards patrolling the maze.

—description from the publisher

Name: GayBar
Description:
GayBar is a LGTBI-THEMED game where your objective is to try to seduce as many guys as you can in one night, but... watch out! Because the bitches of your friends will try to prevent you to get them.

You will be part of a group of gay men (twinks, bears, str8...), and, depending on your role, you will flirt with other men. Everything is played using cards.

When you play your turn, other players can use their cards to go against you.

Name: The Endless Bugle Call
Description: An elementary wargame on Chinese intervenes during the Korean War. Basic system is based on Bonsai Games' Blitzkrieg to Moscow 2 and Russo-Japanese War 1904-1905, using 40 event cards.
